intro: Rhytachne pilosa, commonly known as the hairy rhytachne, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many species of shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and leaves, which give it its common name. It produces small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale pink in color. Rhytachne pilosa is often found in moist, shaded habitats such as forest understories.
